business.headline: JP Morgan warns of 60% chance of global recession after Trump's tariffsFollowing the US-China trade war, global investment firm J.P. Morgan said it now sees a 60% chance of the global economy entering recession by year-end, up from 40% previously.

Wall Street shatters as Trump tariffs trigger worst day in US markets since 2020US markets suffered their steepest decline since 2020 after China retaliated against Trump's tariffs. The S&P 500 fell 6%, fuelling recession fears and intensifying investor anxiety across global markets.

Dow crashes 2,000 points as Trump's tariffs spark global market panicGlobal markets plunged as Trump's tariffs triggered a trade war escalation with China. The Dow fell over 2,000 points, crude prices tumbled, and investors feared an impending global recession.

Higher inflation, slower growth: US Federal Reserve chair warns after Trump tariffsUS Federal Reserve chair Jerome Powell spoke as global markets continued a swoon that has wiped some 10 per cent off major US stock indexes since Trump announced a raft of new tariffs on Wednesday.

US stocks plummet after China's retaliatory levies in response to Trump tariffsNasdaq IXIC dropped more than 20 per cent from its all-time closing high touched in December, putting it on course to confirm a bear market.
Income tax return 2025: ITR-2 filing now made easierITR-2 is meant for individuals whose annual income is above Rs 50 lakh or who earn from sources like rent, capital gains, or other sources.

Sensex tumbles over 900 points, Nifty ends below 23,000; IT, metal stocks crashThe S&P BSE Sensex tumbled 930.67 points to 75,364.69 at the closing bell, while the NSE Nifty50 tumbled 345.65 points to settle at 22,904.45.

IT stocks bleed as market crashes. Why TCS, Infosys, Wipro shares are down?All major IT stocks declined as fears of a US recession led to heavy selling. IT companies earn a large portion of their revenue from the US market, and concerns about a slowdown in technology spending have further weakened investor sentiment.

With 'fancy ice-cream' jab, Piyush Goyal's cold message to Shark Tank judgesPiyush Goyal row: While flagging the trend of Indian startups focusing on 'fancy ice creams' and food delivery apps, Piyush Goyal drew a parallel with China to pitch for more innovation in deep-tech.

RIL share price falls 4% ahead of Q4 results. Should you sell?Reliance Industries stock: RIL shares opened at Rs 1,240 and fell to an intraday low of Rs 1,192.85 in the afternoon session. The stock was close to its 52-week low of Rs 1,156, which it touched on March 3, 2025.

US tariffs stay at 26% as White House unveils new trade documentInitially, India's tariff rate was mentioned as 27% in the earlier version of the White House annex. However, the latest revision has adjusted it to 26%.

Withdrawing EPF? Know rules for marriage, education, home and medical needsIf you require money out of your EPF for the purposes of marriage or further studies, there are set regulations one needs to adhere to. You must have been an EPF member for at least seven years and must have at least Rs 1,000 in your EPF account.

entertainment.headline: RRR stars Ram Charan, Jr NTR to reunite with director Rajamouli, but not for filmRam Charan and Jr NTR, stars of the blockbuster RRR, will join director SS Rajamouli and composer MM Keeravaani for a special Q&A session at London's Royal Albert Hall.

Teary-eyed Amitabh Bachchan attends Manoj Kumar's funeral with son AbhishekVeteran actor Manoj Kumar's last rites are being conducted in Juhu, Mumbai, with several celebrities, including Amitabh Bachchan, present to pay their respects.

Empuraan box office Day 9: Mohanlal film nears Rs 100 crore domesticallyL2 Empuraan continues its impressive box office run, earning Rs 2.9 crore on its ninth day. With a total of Rs 91.15 crore in India and strong overseas earnings, it may become the highest-grossing Malayalam film.

Echoes of the past: Lost charm of Bollywood music, can the glory days be back?It has been a while since the Hindi film industry produced a full album which boasted some memorable tracks. So does this mean Bollywood music has lost its sheen? Artistes such as Lalit Pandit and Shabana Azmi weigh in.

Veteran actor Manoj Kumar to be cremated with state honours in MumbaiVeteran actor Manoj Kumar, known for his patriotic films, will be given a state funeral. The Bollywood fraternity and his family are set to bid him a final farewell, with his last rites scheduled in Juhu at 11:30 am.

Sikandar box office Day 6: Salman Khan film struggles, earns mere Rs 3.75 croreSalman Khan's latest film Sikandar, directed by AR Murugadoss, saw a significant drop at the box office on its sixth day despite a decent start. The film's total domestic collection now stands at Rs 94 crore after earning just Rs 3.75 crore on Day 6.
75 crore on Friday

Jr NTR praises brother-in-law Nithin at MAD Square success bashMAD Square has been a hit among audiences, and Jr NTR couldn't be prouder of his brother-in-law Narne Nithin's acting journey. Speaking at the success bash on Friday, he reminisced about his initial reaction when Nithin first approached him to discuss his aspirations of becoming an actor.
The Last Five Years finally hits Broadway after years of anticipationNick Jonas and Adrienne Warren bring the beloved musical 'The Last Five Years' to Broadway for the first time.

Elizabeth Olsen admits Marvel films aren't her cup of tea: Not the art I consumeActor Elizabeth Olsen opened up about her personal film preferences and how they differ from her roles in the Marvel Cinematic Universe. Despite her pride in playing Wanda Maximoff, she shared the pressure to choose projects that reflect her true taste.
New sex trafficking charges filed against Sean 'Diddy' CombsSean Diddy Combs faces two additional sex trafficking charges, expanding the federal indictment against him.

Good Bad Ugly trailer: Ajith Kumar brings mass back in Adhik Ravichandran's nextThe much-anticipated trailer of Ajith Kumar's Good Bad Ugly is finally out. Directed by Adhik Ravichandran, the film is set to hit theatres on April 10.
James Cameron unveils Avatar Fire and Ash trailer at CinemaConJames Cameron unveiled his Avatar Fire and Ash movie's first trailer at CinemaCon introducing new Na'vi clans.

Actor-comedian Russell Brand charged with rapeRenowned actor and comedian Russell Brand has been charged with serious allegations of rape and sexual assault and oral rape. The alleged offences took place between 1999 and 2005.

Dan Da Dan Season 2: Release date, platform and how to watch it earlyDan Da Dan fans can rejoice as the release date for the second season has been announced, along with an opportunity to watch the first three episodes before the full season airs. The episodes will be available in theatres outside Japan under the title Dan Da Dan: Evil Eye.

Palak Tiwari on criticism of new-gen actors: We'll get there, but it'll take timeActor Palak Tiwari discusses the challenges and criticisms faced by new-generation actors in Bollywood, expressing confidence that they will eventually win over audiences despite the longer time it may take compared to their predecessors.
Jennifer Lopez stuns in plunging gown at Broadway premiere of George Clooney's showJennifer Lopez dazzled at the Broadway premiere of Good Night, and Good Luck, supporting George Clooney.

Rajinikanth's Coolie to hit theatres ahead of Independence DayThe release of Rajinikanth's next film, Coolie, is out. Directed by Lokesh Kanagaraj, it would hit theatres on August 14, ahead of Independence Day.

SRK mourns Manoj Kumar's loss, says he will always be 'Bharat to us'Veteran Bollywood actor and director Manoj Kumar died at 87, leaving a significant impact on Indian cinema. Bollywood celebrities, including Shah Rukh Khan and Salman Khan, paid heartfelt tributes to the legend known as 'Bharat Kumar'.

From killing to reaping souls, Lee Dong-wook is a true masterclass in actingLee Dong-wook is a versatile actor who seamlessly transforms into any role, from the mysterious Grim Reaper in Goblin to the chilling killer in Strangers from Hell and the compassionate insurance worker in Divorce Insurance. In this week's K-Fix, let us take a look at Lee Dong-wook's range as an artiste.

general news.headline: India, Sri Lanka sign 1st defence deal, six other pacts during PM Modi's visit Live UpdatesIn a big announcement and relief to several fishermen from Tamil Nadu, PM Modi said that he had also raised their concerns and declared that Sri Lanka has agreed to the immediate release of any Indian fishermen and the prompt return of their boats.

Trump bets tariffs will 'supercharge' US economy amid Wall Street bloodbathEven as Trump's trade policies led to a bloodbath and panic not only in the US but global markets across Europe and Asia, a defiant Trump told his followers on Truth Social that it 'is a great time to get rich.'

A Kia cue for the BJPThe BJP's national showroom may be packed, but in states like Tamil Nadu, one-size-fits-all politics keep crashing. It's time for a branding revamp - same engine, different badge.

Barack Obama gets candid amid divorce buzz: Was in deep deficit with MichelleRumours of a divorce between Barack Obama and Michelle have swirled for months. It gained traction after Barack Obama was seen without his wife at Donald Trump's inauguration.

Echoes of the past: Lost charm of Bollywood music, can the glory days be back?It has been a while since the Hindi film industry produced a full album which boasted some memorable tracks. So does this mean Bollywood music has lost its sheen? Artistes such as Lalit Pandit and Shabana Azmi weigh in.

JP Morgan warns of 60% chance of global recession after Trump's tariffsFollowing the US-China trade war, global investment firm J.P. Morgan said it now sees a 60% chance of the global economy entering recession by year-end, up from 40% previously.

BookMyShow removes all content of comic Kunal Kamra amid joke row, delists himSoon after the online ticketing platform's decision to delete Kamra from the history list of artists, Shiv Sena (Shinde faction) youth leader Rahool N Kanal welcomed the move, thanking BookMyShow for removing any content linked to the artist.

PM honoured with Sri Lanka's highest civilian award for boosting bilateral tiesThe Mithra Vibhushana medal, specially instituted to recognise extraordinary global friendships, reflects the deep and historic relationship between the two countries. The honour was conferred during Prime Minister Narendra Modi's maiden visit to Sri Lanka in his third term in office.

Gossip can be good. Here's how to make it healthy (and harmless)Beyond its bad reputation, gossiping can also be positive and healthy. Psychologists call it 'social glue' that brings communities together. It is also deemed good for mental health (when it is harmless).

University of Bath School of Management: A Pathway to Global Career SuccessBath's School of Management blends top academics, hands-on learning, and career support to help students secure jobs at leading global companies.

Why US has sent 'ghosts of the sky' to this remote island near IranThe massive deployment of one of the world's most advanced military aircraft, known as 'ghosts of the sky', just 2,400 miles from Iran's coastline, has only added to the tensions in the Middle East.
Katy Perry to go to space: Here's the breakdown of her full flightThe six-member crew will cross the Karman Line and experience weightlessness as part of the brief joyride above the planet.

Tired of job hunt, Bengaluru man posts his obituary on LinkedIn. Internet sees him nowA Bengaluru-based man decided to post his own obituary on LinkedIn after battling unemployment for nearly three years.

In Sri Lanka, PM urges immediate release of Tamil fishermen, their boatsRecurring arrests of fishermen from Tamil Nadu by Sri Lankan authorities have been a long-standing conflict between the two countries.

Oops: Trump shares cinematic video of drone attack on Houthis in YemenThe black-and-white aerial clip, resembling drone footage, appeared to show dozens of people gathered before a massive explosion left a crater and bodies strewn across the area. "They will never sink our ships again!" Trump wrote.

Bill Gates revisits early days as Microsoft turns 50Microsoft turns 50 today and Bill Gates chose to celebrate the day with a memory down the lane. From his early days to building up Microsoft all captured in just a few photos. CEO Satya Nadella has also shared a video, featuring Gates and Copilot.

Teary-eyed Amitabh Bachchan attends Manoj Kumar's funeral with son AbhishekVeteran actor Manoj Kumar's last rites are being conducted in Juhu, Mumbai, with several celebrities, including Amitabh Bachchan, present to pay their respects.
Question Time: Weekly News QuizThink you read the headlines this week? Let's test that!

Gujarat crash accused who shouted 'another round' was high on marijuana: CopsThe accused, Rakshit Chaurasia, had earlier denied consuming alcohol or taking any drugs before the crash, insisting that he was sober at the time the car rammed multiple people.

LSG vs MI: Digvesh Rathi fined again after repeating notebook celebrationLucnow Super Giants spinner Digvesh Rathi was slapped with his second consecutive fine in IPL 2025, after he repeated his notebook celebration against Mumbai Indians. LSG skipper Rishabh Pant was also fined for his side's slow over-rate against MI.

Do you also feel a small electric shock when touching someone? ExplainedFeeling a tiny electric shock when you touch a doorknob, a chair, or even another person? You're not alone; it happens to all of us now and then. That little jolt might be surprising, but it's not unusual. So, what causes this sudden spark? Let's break it down and understand the science behind it.

Indian stabbed to death in Canada's Ottawa, suspect taken into custody: EmbassyThe Indian embassy in Canada confirmed the incident on X and said it was in touch with the victim's family. Authorities have not disclosed the cause of death or whether any charges have been filed.

A Green win as court sees red over Revanth Reddy move to shave off Hyderabad lung spaceWhile Revanth Reddy would argue that this is the oxygen of development Telangana needs, the irony is that he has attempted to take out the green lungs of Hyderabad in an ugly surgical strike using JCB muscle power.

7 women farm labourers dead as tractor plunges into well in MaharashtraIn Maharashtra's Nanded district, a tractor-trolley carrying farm labourers fell into a well, resulting in the death of seven women. The mishap occurred as the driver lost control on a narrow mud road, leading to the vehicle's plunge.

sports.headline: Imam ul Haq hospitalised as New Zealand whitewash Pakistan in Bay OvalPakistan batter Imam-ul-Haq was hospitalised after a freak accident in the Pakistan's 3rd ODI match against New Zealand. Imam was retired hurt after being hit by the ball.

Used to watch Shane Warne videos: DC's Kuldeep Yadav on spin inspirationDelhi Capitals and India star spinner Kuldeep Yadav revealed how he used to watch videos of former Australia spinner Shane Warne's bowling, as his inspiration growing up.

LSG vs MI: Digvesh Rathi fined again after repeating notebook celebrationLucnow Super Giants spinner Digvesh Rathi was slapped with his second consecutive fine in IPL 2025, after he repeated his notebook celebration against Mumbai Indians. LSG skipper Rishabh Pant was also fined for his side's slow over-rate against MI.

Go easy on us: R Ashwin playfully asks DC's KL Rahul to gift CSK two pointsCSK's R Ashwin shared a friendly exchange with KL Rahul, cheekily requesting Delhi to "gift" them a win, as both teams prepare for a crucial IPL 2025 clash at Chepauk, where MS Dhoni may return to captain in Gaikwad's absence.

CSK vs DC live score: Can Chennai Super Kings bounce back to winning ways?IPL 2025 Live Score, Chennai Super Kings (CSK) vs Delhi Capitals (DC): Chennai Super Kings will look to bounce back after suffering back-to-back losses in the IPL 2025. Delhi Capitals, meanwhile, will be eyeing a third straight win.

Glenn Maxwell key spinner for PBKS on any venue: Spin bowling coach Sunil JoshiSpin coach Sunil Joshi backed Glenn Maxwell as a pivotal spinner for Punjab Kings ahead of their IPL 2025 clash against Rajasthan Royals, stressing the Australian's value with the ball even as his batting form remains a work in progress.

Tilak Verma retires out vs LSG: MI coach explains reason behind controversial callMI coach Mahela Jayawardene explained why they decided to retire from Tilak Verma during the loss to LSG. Tilak became the fourth player to be retired out in the IPL.

Dhoni as CSK captain one last time? What to expect if Thala returns in role MS Dhoni could be all set for one last dance as the CSK captain. So what can we expect as Thala makes his return as Chennai captain?

Watch: LSG coach Langer picks call from reporter's mom at presserLSG head coach Justin Langer picked up a call from a reporter's mother on the journalist's phone during the post-match press conference, delivering a hilarious moment after Lucknow's tense win over Mumbai Indians in the IPL 2025 clash.

CSK vs DC Match Preview: Can captain Dhoni's return halt Delhi's progress?IPL 2025, Chennai Super Kings vs Delhi Capitals Match Preview: MS Dhoni might return as the captain as the Chennai Super Kings are looking to halt the progress of Delhi Capitals, who have won both their matches thus far.

Tilak Verma retires out vs LSG: MI coach explains reason behind controversial callMI coach Mahela Jayawardene explained why they decided to retire from Tilak Verma during the loss to LSG. Tilak became the fourth player to be retired out in the IPL.

Dhoni as CSK captain one last time? What to expect if Thala returns in role MS Dhoni could be all set for one last dance as the CSK captain. So what can we expect as Thala makes his return as Chennai captain?

CSK vs DC Match Preview: Can captain Dhoni's return halt Delhi's progress?IPL 2025, Chennai Super Kings vs Delhi Capitals Match Preview: MS Dhoni might return as the captain as the Chennai Super Kings are looking to halt the progress of Delhi Capitals, who have won both their matches thus far.

education.headline: The role of data analytics in modern advertising educationThis transformation also exercises a significant impact on the realm of 'advertising education.'

NCERT deletes Azad Pak, adds China's aggression reference in Class 12 textbookThe NCERT has made final changes to its Class 12 Political Science textbook syllabus for the upcoming academic year, including a revision in reference to India's border situation with China, Azad Pakistan, Article 370 and more.

NEET row: Bihar cops find 6 post-dated cheques 'issued for question paper brokers'Six post-dated cheques which were suspected to have been issued in favour of mafia demanding over Rs 30 lakh from each candidate seeking alleged leaked question paper ahead of NEET held last month were recovered by Bihar Police.

Forest fires surge tenfold from 2004 to 2017: Causes, impact and preventionAmidst a relentless surge, intense forest fires are now multiplying tenfold, casting a menacing shadow over our flora and fauna. Year by year, their fiery grip tightens, threatening ecosystems far and wide, now extending their reach to impact human lives.

Fresh plea in Supreme Court to recall NEET results, reconduct examsA fresh petition has been filed in the Supreme Court to recall the National Entrance cum Eligibility Test - Under Graduate (NEET-UG) 2024 results and re-conduct fresh examination after discrepancies in the declared results.

NTA issues clarification after NEET result controversy over toppers, high cut-offIn a detailed statement, the National Testing Agency (NTA) said that the increase in cut-off and number of toppers in the NEET-UG reflect the competitive nature of the exam and maintained that the test's integrity has not been compromised.

Exclusive: Arvind Kejriwal claims 'BJP succession war, PM backing Amit Shah'Speaking exclusively to India Today TV, Delhi Chief Minister Arvind Kejriwal claimed that there is a "succession war" within the BJP. He also claimed that the ruling party is "not fighting the Lok Sabha elections as a team".

4 medical students arrested in Bihar for appearing as proxies for NEET aspirantsFour MBBS students who appeared in place of NEET aspirants in the medical entrance exam were detained in Bihar's Purnea.

NEET-UG question paper not leaked, claims baseless: National Testing AgencyThe reports claiming question paper leak in the medical entrance exam NEET-UG are "completely baseless and without any ground", the National Testing Agency (NTA) has clarified.
The generation with answers: Tech-savvy Indian youth tackling global challengesIndia's tech-savvy youth rewriting the global narrative, one solution at a time.

Left sweeps JNU students' polls, Dhananjay is first Dalit presidentThe Left swept the Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls, winning all four posts and trouncing the RSS-affiliated ABVP. The ABVP was leading at one point, but the Left eventually surged ahead and emerged victorious.
The power of knowledge: Education's influence on real estate market trendsIn a dynamic sector like real estate, investing in continuing education is not simply an option; it is a requirement.

JNU students' body election on March 22 after 4 yearsThe Jawaharlal Nehru University Students' Union (JNUSU) polls will take place on March 22, more than four years after the last elections were held in September 2019.

UP 12th board exam math, biology papers leaked on WhatsApp, complaint filedThe mathematics and biology question papers for the Uttar Pradesh class 12 board exam were allegedly leaked on a WhatsApp group.

UP Police Constable recruitment exam cancelled days after paper leakThe Uttar Pradesh Police Constable recruitment exam held on February 17 and 18 was canceled due to a paper leak. The Chief Minister has announced a re-examination within the next six months.
Jawaharlal Nehru University: Brains trustTeaching and research go hand in hand at the institute which is proud of its activist tradition.
